tool.name: DocxToDMU

param.name: DMU_manuscript_file
param.dialogReference: Microsoft Word .docx file formatted according to USGS template MapManuscript_v1-0_04-11.dotx.

param.name: Geologic_map_geodatabase
param.dialogReference:
Dialog Reference

GeMS-style geodatabase with DescriptionOfMapUnits table. DMU table may be empty or partly complete.

tool.summary:
THIS CODE IS NOT COMPLETE! No progress messages, little error trapping. Code to reverse translation (DMU table to docx DMU manuscript) needs even more work.

Script extracts DMU paragraphs from Microsoft Word document formatted according to USGS Pubs template MapManuscript_v1-0_04-11.dotx, calculates HierarchyKey, and partially fills in table DescriptionOfMapUnits. Non-DMU paragraphs (e.g., the rest of the map text) are ignored.

DMU paragraphs in the manuscript must be tagged with styles DMU-Heading1, DMU-Heading2, DMU Headnote, DMU Paragraph, DMU Unit 1, DMU Unit 1 (1st after heading), DMU Unit 2, etc. Some character formatting (bold, italic, superscript, subscript, DMU Unit Label character style, FGDCGeoAge font) is recognized.

If a paragraph is a unit description, UnitLabl in the map manuscript is related to field Label in the database table DescriptionOfMapUnits. If the paragraph is a heading, the heading text is matched to the Name field in DescriptionOfMapUnits. If a headnote, the first 20 characters of the headnote text is matched to the Description field. If a matching row is not present in DescriptionOfMapUnits, a new row is created.

Values of UnitLabl in the manuscript must be unique.

The lxml package (http:lxml.de) must be installed on the host computer for this script to run.

Script extracts DMU paragraphs from Microsoft Word document formatted according to USGS Pubs template MapManuscript_v1-0_04-11.dotx, calculates HierarchyKey, and partially fills in table DescriptionOfMapUnits. Non-DMU paragraphs (e.g., the rest of the map text) are ignored.

If a paragraph is a unit description, UnitLabl in the map manuscript is related to field Label in the database table DescriptionOfMapUnits. If the paragraph is a heading, the heading text is matched to the Name field in DescriptionOfMapUnits. If a headnote, the first 20 characters of the headnote text is matched to the Description field. If a matching row is not present in DescriptionOfMapUnits, a new row is created.

Values of UnitLabl in the manuscript must be unique.

The lxml package (http:lxml.de) must be installed on the host computer for this script to run.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Includes modified version of docx module by Mike MacCana

Consts.useLimit: Good luck! Not guaranteed to yield useful results.
